WorkItem.Description:
Hi All
 
I am loving this utility.  I am currently facing a small problem. I want to merge XML file in to existing Excel file. 
-------------------------
To explain it my xml file looks like this:
--------------------------------------
<phrase section="default" code="loggingout"><![CDATA[Logging out...]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="no_wait"><![CDATA[Please click here if you are not automatically redirected to the next page]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="loginerrorinvalidsession"><![CDATA[Invalid Session ID]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="loginerror"><![CDATA[Invalid username or password]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="loginsuccess"><![CDATA[Logged in successfully]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="myaccount"><![CDATA[My Account]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="changepassword"><![CDATA[Change Password]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="logout"><![CDATA[[Logout]]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="loggedinas"><![CDATA[Logged In:&nbsp]]></phrase>
<phrase section="default" code="registerlogin"><![CDATA[Register]]></phrase>
 ------------------------------------------------------
 
And my excel file look like this:
                       A                                         B                                      C                                                    D 
1                   section                                  code                                 
2                   default                                   loggingout                      Log out
3                    default                                  registerlogin                    Register
4                     default                                 logout                           Log Out..
 
--------------------------------
 
Now compare the section and code from each phrase node of xml file  to excel row and put the new value in Column D.
 
I have tried to do it with writing PHP script but i think its messy way.
 
Any other easy, proper way to do this??
 
Thank you in Advance,
 
Regards
Kalpan

Comments.Message: Hmm... Not sure exactly what feature you are asking for. Are you basically asking for XML data import?

Sorry for my poorly written question.

Yes I am after XML import functionality

Regards
Kalpan

Ok, changing title of this feature request.

Export XML and merge it in to Excel
>> Import XML data
Wondering if we should do this, as almost every .xml file will look different.
